item.title: OpenAI confirms ChatGPT's new study feature, helps with exams
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is testing a new 'Study together' feature, and today, a new announcement within the ChatGPT web app confirms it. [...]

item.title: How to harden your Active Directory against Kerberoasting
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: Kerberoasting gives attackers offline paths to crack service account password, without triggering alerts. Learn from Specops Software how to protect your Active Directory with stronger SPN password policies and reduced attack surfaces. [...]

item.title: OpenAI prepares Sora 2 to take on Google's Veo 3
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI has had enough of Google's Veo 3 dominating generative AI videos and is now working on Sora 2, the successor to Sora. [...]

item.title: Ukraine arrests suspected admin of XSS Russian hacking forum
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The suspected administrator of the Russian-speaking hacking forum XSS.is was arrested by the Ukrainian authorities yesterday at the request of the Paris public prosecutor's office. [...]

item.title: CISA warns of hackers exploiting SysAid vulnerabilities in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA has warned that attackers are actively exploiting two security vulnerabilities in the SysAid IT service management (ITSM) software to hijack administrator accounts. [...]

item.title: npm 'accidentally' removes Stylus package, breaks builds and pipelines
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: npm has taken down all versions of the Stylus library and replaced them with a "security holding" page, breaking pipelines and builds worldwide that rely on the package. [...]

item.title: Operator of Jetflix illegal streaming service gets 7 years in prison
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The ringleader of the Jetflicks illegal paid streaming operation, a massive service with tens of thousands of subscribers, was sentenced to seven years in prison. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes bug behind incorrect Windows Firewall errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has resolved a known issue that triggers invalid Windows Firewall errors after rebooting Windows 11 24H2 systems with the June 2025 preview update installed. [...]

item.title: Lumma infostealer malware returns after law enforcement disruption
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Lumma infostealer malware operation is gradually resuming activities following a massive law enforcement operation in May, which resulted in the seizure of 2,300 domains and parts of its infrastructure. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5062660 update brings new 'Windows Resilience' features
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: ​​Microsoft has released the KB5062660 preview cumulative update for Windows 11 24H2 with twenty-nine new features or changes, with many gradually rolling out, such as the new Black Screen of Death and Quick Machine Recovery tool. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 gets new Black Screen of Death, auto recovery tool
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft is rolling out significant changes to Windows 11 24H2 as part of the Windows Resilience Initiative, designed to reduce downtime and help devices recover from serious failures, as well as an overhaul of the all-too-familiar BSOD crash screens. [...]

item.title: Coyote malware abuses Windows accessibility framework for data theft
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new variant of the banking trojan 'Coyote' has begun abusing a Windows accessibility feature, Microsoft's UI Automation framework, to identify which banking and cryptocurrency exchange sites are accessed on the device for potential credential theft. [...]

item.title: CISA and FBI warn of escalating Interlock ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA and the FBI warned on Tuesday of increased Interlock ransomware activity targeting businesses and critical infrastructure organizations in double extortion attacks. [...]
